recipe.title: Noodle Salad With Chicken and Chile-Scallion Oil
ingredients: 6 ounces Japanese wheat noodles (such as ramen, somen, or udon)
1/2 large English hothouse cucumber, halved lengthwise, thinly sliced
1 cup cilantro leaves or any sprout
instructions: Cook all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat, swirling pan occasionally, until scallions and garlic are just golden brown, about 3 minutes. Let cool; transfer oil to a jar.
DO AHEAD: Chile oil can be made 4 days ahead. Cover and chill.

For noodles and assembly: Cook noodles in a large pot of boiling water according to package directions; drain. Rinse noodles under cold water, then shake off as much water as possible. Whisk soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and oil in a medium bowl until sugar dissolves. Add noodles, chicken, and scallions; toss to coat. Toss with cucumber, radishes, and cilantro and drizzle with chile oil just before serving. DO AHEAD: Noodles can be cooked the night before. Toss with 1 teaspoon oil; cover and chill. Store noodles with chicken; store vegetables and dressing separately.
